channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping, 26th July
item.description:
Items dumped next to bins outside residence and on pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Close, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Accident Hotspot, 26th July
item.description:
A few parking spots up to the bin need to be removed and replaced with double yellow lines. Currently there is a pinch point and I have witnessed multiple car accidents due to the pinch point it creates, causing vehicles to run into the kerb on one side, or into parked vehicles on the other, especially at busy times it also causes traffic jams in one direction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Sumner Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raw meat and rubbish bags dumped, 26th July
item.description:
Next to the electrical box on the corner of Lullingstone Crescent and Borstal someone has dumped 2 maybe 3 black bags. Covered in flies and looks like raw meat. Not safe for local wildlife and smells very bad.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lullingstone Crescent, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The graffiti on the fence, 26th July
item.description:
After driving through the A2 I noticed several graffiti signs on the fence, by Kidbrook Village. The whole of the A2 is littered with graffiti and it looks awful. Like a third world country and this should be cleared up. If you drive from Danson Park to the o2 please look at how much graffiti there is and looks disgusting. Please find a team to clear this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way Relief Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown Cladophora in Canal, 26th July
item.description:
The overgrown Cladophora should be removed or reduce. Excessive growth is a red flag for nutrient pollution and ecosystem imbalance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redbourne Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes, 26th July
item.description:
Numerous potholes need to be repaired. The council before decided to repair just one pot hole and it was awful. There must be around 10 large holes that need filling
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 124, Ramillies Road, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No right turn at junction of Alleyn Park and Paxton Green roundabout has been hit or turned so that it is no longer visible to motorists approaching the roundabout. Motorists are turning right into South Croxted Road, 26th July
item.description:
Motorists turning right into South Croxted Road are potentially causing a dangerous situation especially for pedestrians. There is no damage to the sign, it just needs to be repositioned on the existing pole. Suggest urgent action before an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baird Gardens, London
Report on FixMyStreet
